oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1954-04-25 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program Sunday Down South, sponsored by Lion Oil. Originally broadcast 1954-04-25, part 2. Tribute to Tommy Dorsey. Personnel include Buddy Hall (host, performer), David Cobb (announcer), Owen Bradley (conductor) and the Lion Orchestra (performer) including Beverly DeCroy (trombone) and Dutch Gordon (trombone), the Anita Kerr Singers (performers), and Dolores Watson (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Buddy Hall; Owen Bradley; Lion Orchestra; Anita Kerr Singers; Dolores Watson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Buddy Hall talks about Tommy Dorsey -- Take Me (Buddy Hall) -- Lion Oil commercial -- Lion Oil jingle (Dolores Watson) -- Buddy Hall introduces the Anita Kerr Singers -- On The Sunny Side Of The Street (Anita Kerr Singers) -- Lion Oil commercial (David Cobb, Buddy Hall) -- Buddy Hall introduces Dolores Watson -- Manhattan Serenade (Dolores Watson) -- Buddy Hall talks about Tommy Dorsey -- I'll Never Smile Again (Buddy Hall, Anita Kerr Singers) -- Closing statement (Buddy Hall) -- Lion Oil commercial (David Cobb) -- Theme (Got The South In My Soul) -- Closing statement (David Cobb)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Sunday down south (Radio program); Cobb, David (Announcer); Hall, Buddy (Singer); Bradley, Owen; Lion Orchestra (Musical group); Gordon, Dutch; LeCroy, Beverly; Anita Kerr Singers
